page.title: 06FARMING REDBROOK + DISTRICT
page.content: The farming in this area is mostly { {mixed}with both{arable}land and livestock on all the farms.The ratio of areas of land used are approx. { {CROPS}:{GRASS}:{ROUGH GRAZING} 2 : 4 : 1 Crops = crops other than grass,and Grass = intensively managed grass. {Crops}include barley,oats,turnips, swedes and kale.Most of this is used as feed on the farm; only a few farms sell them.{The livestock}is largely store-cattle (for beef),400+ and sheep 1200-1400(mostly for wool some for meat).A few of the farms keep 3-5 horses,a few goats and poultry.Several farms grow{fruit}:apples (sold for cider) and plums.One farm keeps a {dairy}herd of 50 Fresian cattle (+ 1 Hereford bull) on 122 acres using a new dairy complex.
